synopsis: Kidnapped as a child and forced to eat sweets by his captor, Keiichiro Tachibana decides to face the horrors of his dark past by opening a bakery.
After an injury forces a world champion boxer to give up his sport forever, he sees a help wanted sign at Antique and his love of sweets leads him to apply.
A gloomy day of drizzling rain slows sales at Antique but the day takes an interesting turn after the arrival of a surprise guest.
Kobayakawa’s arrival triggers Tachibana's nightmares to return.
Tachibana decides that Antique should participate in a food fair that’s being covered by the local media.
Love and trouble are in the air. One of the most famous patissiers in France arrives at the shop and declares his love for Ono, which could mean the end of Antique.
It’s Christmas and the Antique staff decides to go all out for their customers.
The Antique staff gets quite a shock when a young girl shows up and flings herself on Kobayakawa.
Ono pushes Kanda to take French lessons so he can attend culinary school in France.
When Ono’s sister shows up at the shop it dredges up a lot of mixed emotions about his broken childhood home.
Tachibana agrees to work with the local police to help track down the kidnapper who's been in the news. But is one of Antique’s customers the culprit?
After a hectic night Tachibana struggles to come to terms with everything that happened.
